tuv.seg: Overview of the various types of evidence that can be introduced in a civil or criminal trial in Ireland
Cur síos atá anseo ar na cineálacha fianaise gur féidir a tharraingt anuas i dtriail sibhialta nó choiriúil in Éirinn
There are rules in Ireland about how the scene of a serious crime is preserved and investigated
Tá rialacha i bhfeidhm in Éirinn ar conas láthair tromchoire a chosaint agus ar conas imscrúdú a dhéanamh uirthi
Read about these rules and what happens if the crime scene is on private property or in a public place
Tugtar faisnéis duit ar na rialacha seo agus ar na treoracha go gcaithfear a chomhlíonadh i gcás coire ar réadmhaoin phríobháideach nó in áiteanna poiblí
This document discusses real evidence, which is real, tangible evidence, such as an object, tape recording, computer printout or photograph
Tá cur síos sa cháipéis seo ar fhíorfhianaise, sin í fianaise ábharach, inláimhsithe mar shampla rud, taifead caiséid, asphrionta ríomhaire nó grianghraf
Documentary evidence in Ireland consists of anything with writing on it
Is fianaise scríofa é rud ar bith a bhfuil scríobh air
What items would this include and how is this evidence admissable in court?
Cé na rudaí a bheadh san áireamh anseo agus cén chaoi a ndéantar fianaise mar seo a cheadú sa chúirt?
Identification evidence in Ireland is evidence given by a victim or a witness that identifies the accused as the person who committed the crime
Fianaise a thugann an té a d'fhulaing nó fianaise a thugann finné a ainmníonn an cúisí mar an té a rinne an choir í fianaise aitheantais
DNA evidence is often used in trials in Ireland to establish identity
Is iondúil go mbaintear úsáid as fianaise DNA i dtrialacha le aitheantas daoine a chruthú
Find out how this evidence is used and introduced
Faigh amach anseo cén chaoi a mbaintear úsáid as an bhfianaise seo
Circumstantial evidence is evidence of facts from which inferences or conclusions can be drawn in a criminal trial in Ireland
Tugtar fianaise imthoisceach ar fhianaise a bhaineann le fíricí gur féidir conclúidí nó tuairimí a bhaint astu
Suspect evidence is evidence that is admissable in court in Ireland but is suspect, i.e., it often turns out to be untrue or incorrect
Fianaise atá ceadaithe sa chúirt ach atá amhrastúil í fianaise amhrastúil, sin le rá gur fianaise í seo a bhíonn bréagach nó mícheart go minic sa deireadh
What is hearsay evidence?
Céard í fianaise chlostráchta?
Why usually can this evidence not be introduced in court in Ireland and what are the exceptions where hearsay evidence is admissable?
Cén fáth nach féidir go hiondúil an fhianaise seo a tharraingt anuas sa chúirt agus céard iad na heisceachtaí inár féidir fianaise chlostráchta a cheadú?
Evidence that is obtained in deliberate and conscious breach of your constitutional rights is inadmissable in courts in Ireland
Ní cheadaítear fianaise a fritheadh ar bhealach a sháraigh d'aonturas agus go fiosach do chearta bunreachtúla a úsáid i gcúirteanna na hÉireann
There are circumstances under which you may refuse to disclose documents to a court in Ireland or may refuse to answer certain questions in court
Tá cúinsí ann ina bhféadfadh tú diúltú cáipéisí a chur ar fáil don chúirt nó ceisteanna faoi leith a fhreagairt sa chúirt
